description.en: The course is divided into 4-5 subprojects. Every project will start with the in silico design of the genetic/protein circuits to be built with the aim to gain the desired biological function. This stage will be held separately, few weeks before the laboratory stage in order to order the synthetic DNA and other missing reagents. Each student will participate in at least two different projects. The list of the projects is subject to changes in each year depending on the progress and emerging new ideas.
description.et: Praktikum on jaotatud 4-5 alamprojektiks. Iga projekt algab geneetiliste/valgu signaalivõrgustike in silico disainiga, mille eesmärgiks on luua uus bioloogiline funktsioon. See esimene etapp viiakse läbi eraldi, mõned nädalad enne kursuse laboratoorse osa algust, et oleks aega tellida sünteetilne DNA ja vajaminevad reagendid. Iga üliõpilane osaleb vähemalt kahes alamprojektis. Projektide nimekiri muutub igal aastal vastavalt arengule ja uute ideede esilekerkimisele.

objectives.en: The course will provide the students the hands-on experience on a wide variety of laboratory techniques and protocols used in synthetic biology. Most importantly, the course enhances creative thinking in using the building blocks of genetic circuits and protein modules, and also seeds the engineering attitude towards biological systems. It also combines techniques from different disciplines, including electronics, biosensors, sustainable bioprocessing, organic synthesis etc.
objectives.et: Praktikum annab üliõpilastele otsese praktilise kogemuse erinevate sünteetilises bioloogias kasutatavate laboratoorsete meetodite ja protokollide alal. Peamine kursuse juures on see, et arendatakse loovat mõtlemist kasutades sünteetiliste bioloogiliste süsteemide disainiks geneetiliste signaalivõrgustike ja valgumoodulite aluselemente. Selline lähenemine ärgitab kasutama insenerimõtlemist bioloogiliste süsteemide kontekstis. Samuti kombineerib praktikum meetodeid erinevatest distsipliinidest nagu näiteks elektroonika, biosensorid, jätkusuutlik biotöötlus, orgaaniline süntees etc.

learning_outcomes.en: The aim of the lab is to guide the students through the entire creative cycle required for the design of synthetic biological systems with novel functions. The participants will go through all stages of the design-build-test process followed by analysis and interpretation of the outcome. The analysis stage provides new ideas for improving the performance of the designed cells, or even further, ideas for novel approaches and functions. In this way, the course can potentially evolve into continuously developing engineering projects, where the prototypes will be improved and further developed in each year.
learning_outcomes.et: Praktikumi eesmärgiks on juhatada üliõpilased läbi sünteetiliste bioloogiliste süsteemide disaini loomingulise tsükli. Proovitakse läbi kõik disain-konstrueerimine-testimine protsessi etapid, millele järgneb tulemuste analüüs ja interpreteerimine.

description.et: Yeast part Test 1: Golden Gate assembly (max 10 points)
Yeast part Test 2: MoClo kit assembly method (max 10 points)
Yeast part Test 3: on the article "Industrial brewing yeast engineered for the production of primary flavor determinants in hopped beer" (max 10 points)
Yeast part: Homework in Benchling (max 10 points)
Yeast part Test 4: Golden gate assembly in Benchling (max 10 points)
Yeast part Test 5: Protein phosphorylation and degradation (max 10 points)

Yeast part. 
1. Participation in ALL practical sessions
2. Correctly filled lab journal.
3. Oral examination based on the practice material (automatic A for Yeast part in case all tests and homework are above 91%)

Mammalian part. 
1. Participation in ALL practical sessions
2. Correctly filled lab journal.
3. Oral examination based on the practice material

grade_preconditions.et: Praktikas osalemine, katsepäeviku olemasolu ja täitmine.

debt_elimination.et:
In agreement with supervisors

Kokkuleppel õppejõuga.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
1. Organisational info (safety, attendance, what needs to be done to pass, evaluation criteria)
2. PRETEST: topics from the Synthetic Biology lab I course yeast part (selftest)
3. Theory: what we are going to do and what modules do we need, Golden gate assembly theory, reaction mix components and their role in the reaction, reaction conditions.
4. Minipreps of MoClo GG kit parts (pYTK002, pYTK003, pYTK004, pYTK005, pYTK010, pYTK011, pYTK012, pYTK014, pYTK051, pYTK052, pYTK063, pYTK064, pYTK067, pYTK 068, pYTK069, pYTK072, pYTK095)
5. PCR of genes and degrons (Erg20, mcLIS, obGES, trHMG1, STST degron, AAAA degron).

1. Electrophoresis of the PCR products in the 1% agarose gel
TEST 1: Golden Gate assembly
Analylis of agarose gel electrophoresis
Purification of PCR products from the agarose gel
Theory: Yeast MoClo kit: principles, use cases.
2. In silico assembly of Modules in Benchling by student (Modules 1, 2 , 3, 4), will start in class, student need to complete at home
3. Golden Gate assembly of Transcriptional units

1. TEST 2: MoClo kit assembly method
2a. Bacterial transformation with Golden Gate assemblies of transcriptional units 
2b. In Silico restriction analysis of TU assemblies in Benchling
4. consultation (OPTIONAL)

1. TEST 3: on the article "Industrial brewing yeast engineered for the production of primary flavor determinants in hopped beer"
2. Check colonies of TU Golden gate transformations under blue/UV light to initially confirm the assembly appeared
3. Do minis of golden gate transformation succesful colonies
4. Restriction analysis of minis 
5. Students prepare sequencing forms and samples for sequencing
6. Golden gate assembly of multigene casette (Module1, module 2, module 3, module 4, pre-assembled backbone) in benchling (HOME TASK)

1. Golden gate assembly of multigene casette (Module1, module 2, module 3, module 4, pre-assembled backbone) in real life (NB! 15 cycles)
2. TEST 4: Golden gate assembly in Benchling
3. Analysis of sequences of Transcriptional unit plasmids.
4. Transformation of Turbo cells with golden gate assemblies of multigene cassette

1. Colonies under blue/UV light to confirm the multigene cassette assembly was succesful 
2. Do minis of golden gate transformation succesful colonies
3. Restriction analysis of minis of multigene cassette + in silico restriction analysis of multigene cassette
4. Liniarize Multigene cassette plasmid with NotI
5. Transform yeast with liniarize Multigene cassette. Plate out onto -LEU/Glc plate

1. Theory: Protein phosphorylation and degradation 
2. Colony check PCR
3. Inoculation of CSM media with yeast containing multigene cassette

1. Extract metabolites from yeast cells
2. Prepare samples for GC/MS
3. TEST 5: Protein phosphorylation and degradation
Oral examination
GC/MS analysis part 1
GC/MS analysis part 2

10.15-12.00 - Lecture
12.00-14.00
- Taking cells up (BHK, U2OS)
- Linearization of pCHIKV-Replicon with NotI/purification/agarose gel

10.15-14.00
	- Starting session/10-minutes test
	- In vitro transcription of CHIKV-Replicon and checking by gel electrophoresis
- Monitoring BHK and U2OS cells by microscopy (healthiness, confluency, contamination)

10.15-14.00
	- Starting session/10-minutes test
	- Electroporating 100 mm plate of BHK cells with in vitro synthesized CHIKV-Replicon RNA
- Passaging BHK and U2OS cells. Seeding U2OS cells on three 100 mm plates for Monday's experiment (applying Puromycin selection for BHK cells)

10.15-14.00
	- Starting session/10-minutes test
- Seed the BHK/CHIKV-Replicon cells to the 96-well plate for the WST-1 assay
- Seed U2OS cells onto two 35 mm plates for lipofection by EGFP- and luciferase-expressing plasmids (add two cover slips to one of the plates before seeding)

10.15-14.00
	- Starting session/10-minutes test
- Electroporation of U2OS cells with the plasmids expressing EGFP and luciferase marker (use 5/6 of 100 mm plate per electroporation). For EGFP plasmid add two cover slips before seeding cells after electroporation!
- Lipofection of U2OS cells on 35 mm plate prepared on Monday with the plasmids expressing EGFP marker.
- Add Ribavirin dilutions to BHK/CHIKV-Replicon stable cell line seeded on 96-well plate for WST-1 viability assay.

10.15-14.00
- Starting session/10-minutes test
- WST-1 assay for BHK/CHIKV-Replicon stable cell line treated with Ribavirin
- Fix cover slips with U2OS transfected by electroporation/lipofection with paraformaldehyde. Mount cover slips onto the preparative glasses.
- Seed BHK/CHIKV-Replicon cells on 24-well plates  for the Ribavirin inhibition assay.

10.15-14.00
	- Starting session/10-minute test
	- Analyze WST-1 viability assay (BHK/CHIKV-Replicon stable cell line treated with Ribavirin dilutions)
	- Add Ribavirin dilutions to pre-seeded BHK/CHIKV-Replicon cells
- Freezing BHK and U2OS cells

10.15-14.00
	- Starting session/10-minute test
	- Lyse the BHK/CHIKV-Replicon cells on 24-well plate treated with Ribavirin for luciferase assay
	- Perform fluorescent microscopy analysis of the cover slips containing U2OS cells transfected with EGFP-expressing plasmid.
	- Analysis of the luciferase assay
10.15-14.00	Reporting results

audience.et: Only for 3rd year Science and Technology bachelor students!
